alert.note: Alert for Orange (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 8:01PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, Orange. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 801 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anaheim, Santa Ana, Irvine, Huntington Beach, Garden Grove, Orange, Fullerton, Costa Mesa, Mission Viejo, Tustin, Yorba Linda, San Clemente, Stanton, Seal Beach, Laguna Beach, Newport Beach, Dana Point, Westminster, Buena Park and Laguna Niguel. This advisory includes the Bond Fire burn scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
